column4: i need help partitioning and installing a dual boot,the website on partitioning by ub untu did not make sense nor work for me,can someone please help me
windows 7 and tango studio(10.,4ubuntu)or avlinux or 64studio

If you already have windows installed, just boot your flavor of ubuntu live, then select to install and auto-partition unless you want a specific partition setup in which case you would select manual partition option
yea i goot that far but there are 3 small partitions that are really small so i dont know what tpo do
You probably should just leave them as they are and just install ubuntu
In some cases, you may need to resize your windows partition from within windows
yea i did that and made 500gb of free space
Then you should be good to go
in the live  install itg says that space is "unusable"
I guess windows didn't properly free it then..
do i need to make a blank partition in windows and mark it fat32 or somin then install?
No, you don't want to create a partition, you only want to shrink the windows partition
Is it labeled as free space or a partition? (the 500GB)
the partition graph free space,the partition table right under it "unusable"
Can you pastebin the output of 'sudo fdisk -l' to pastebin.com?
The first two likely belong to the windows 7 system, not sure what the other two are. Try deleting them from windows if they're not holding any valuable data
